title: Health, agriculture, fisheries and public works projects (very vague-not a project)
description: LISBON, Dec 15 (AFP) - President Kumba Yala of Guinea-Bissau said Sunday he would seek financial aid from China during his current visit to the country to help pay public servants' salaries and hold early legislative elections.'Our immediate priorities are to secure financial aid for the public service and the organization of elections,' he said following a meeting with immigrants from the tiny west African nation in Beijing, the Lusa news agency reported.Yala has said an exact date for the poll will be set after he returns to Guinea-Bissau on Wednesday, with the election taking place within the first three months of 2003.A parliamentary election had not been due in the former Portuguese colony until the end of 2003, but Yala on November 15 dismissed a government which he accused of incompetence and dissolved the National Assembly, citing a 'ery serious economic crisis'.The country, one of the poorest in the world, has since been run by a caretaker cabinet dominated by members of Yala's Social Renovation Party (PRS).The PRS does not have a majority in the outgoing parliament which had been elected in 1999.Under the constitution, a parliamentary election should be held within 90 days of the dissolution of the National Assembly.The country's National Electoral Commission said last month it was ready to hold elections as early as February but needed 2.2 million euros (dollars) to prepare the poll.Yala, who arrived in Peking on Saturday on the start a five-day official visit to China, said he would also seek aid for infrastructure projects, particularly those that develop the nation's communication network.He is scheduled to meet with Chinese President Jiang Zemin on Monday in Beijing and will travel on Tuesday to the coastal city of Shanghai for a meeting with Prime Minister Zhu Rongji.China currently aids the small country of 1.3 million people with numerous development projects in the areas of health, agriculture, fisheries and public works.China and Guinea-Bissau re-established diplomatic ties in 1998 after an eight-year hiatus, following the recognition of Taiwan by Bissau's then president Joao Bernardo Vieira.Guinea-Bissau held its first multiparty legislative elections in 1994, 20 year after gaining independence from Portugal, but its transition back to democracy has been complicated by its crippled economy, which was devastated in a civil war.

title: Bilateral economic and technological cooperation (too vague-not a project)
description: Text of report in English by official Chinese news agency Xinhua (New China News Agency)Beijing, 16 December: President Jiang Zemin on Monday [16 December] expressed his appreciation and gratitude to President Kumba Yala and the Government of Guinea-Bissau for its one-China policy and for its support of China's reunification cause.President Jiang told President Yala, who is currently on a working visit to China, that the strengthening of bilateral friendship and expansion of friendly cooperation will serve the common interests of the people of China and Guinea-Bissau, both developing countries.Despite the great geographic distance, Jiang said, the people of the two countries have cherished their friendship since the time of the struggle for independence in Guinea-Bissau.In spite of setbacks in bilateral relations, the two countries opened a new chapter in their relationship after the resumption of their diplomatic relations in 1998, Jiang noted. Bilateral cooperation in the areas of politics, trade and health has since progressed smoothly.Over the years, China has offered assistance to Guinea-Bissau within its capacity and it will actively encourage its strong firms to invest in the African nation and help upgrade bilateral relations to new high, he said.Moreover, Jiang briefed Yala on China's stance on the issue of Taiwan and the follow-up actions after the ministerial-level China-Africa Cooperation Forum was held successfully in the year 2000.Following the forum, China fulfilled its commitment to forgive debt by signing agreements with 31 African countries. China-Africa cooperation in the areas of human resources development, tourism, environmental protection and finance has also been enhanced.And a senior officials meeting was held last month in Ethiopia in preparation for the second ministerial-level cooperation forum to be held next year.President Jiang said he was convinced that, through the joint efforts of both China and African nations, the follow-up actions of the forum will go on moving forward, and the mechanism of the ministerial-level meeting will effectively advance China-Africa relations.President Yala thanked China for its assistance, and said the Chinese people are the sincere, great friends of the people of Guinea-Bissau.Moreover, the president said, although Guinea Bissau had made mistakes in its relations with China, it has finally returned to the correct path and resolutely severed all form of its relations with Taiwan.Yala re-affirmed that it has been the set policy of the Government of Guinea-Bissau to resolutely uphold the one-China policy and to support China's territorial integrity and reunification cause.Guinea-Bissau President Yala said that his country highly values China's experience in its economic growth and hopes to learn from China. He also urged Chinese business people to invest in his country.Following the talks, the two presidents attended a ceremony during which the two governments signed an agreement on bilateral economic and technological cooperation.

title: Economic assistance grant (May not be bilateral)
description: In July of 2002, Madagascar held a conference to display its reform initiatives and seek financing from abroad. The conference was chaired by Mr. Hafez Ghanem, the World Bank Country Director for Madagascar, Comoros, Mauritius, and the Seychelles. Although China was listed as a donor among a large list of other donors as a result of this conference, no evidence can be found of a Chinese commitment during this conference.

title: China Donates Money to Help Mozambican Flood Victims.
description: On November 20, 200, A visiting delegation from China's National People's Congress (NPC) Monday donated 200,000 U. S. dollars to the Mozambican Assembly to help victims of the floods hit the southern African country in February this year.  What the money was used for was not disclosed.
sector: Humanitarian and Disaster Relief and Preparation

title: Money Donation to First Lady (Duplicate of 27650)
description: China Donates Oer M33,000 to Office of First Lady.274 words25 August 200301:20 PMAll AfricaAFNWSEnglish(c) Distributed via COMTEX News.Maseru, Aug 21, 2003 (Mopheme/The Survior/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) - The Embassy of the Peoples' Republic of China in Lesotho has donated M33 745.00 to the Office of the First Lady Mathato Mosisili. The donation was made in Maseru on Thursday, last week.The representative of the Chinese Ambassador Xhang Tiejian said the offer was aimed at empowering Basotho people in their income generating projects targeted at creating more jobs and reducing poverty, and to strengthen and re-affirm the long-standing relations between Lesotho and China.In her vote of thanks, The First Lady 'Mathato Mosisili thanked the Government of China for responding to her pleas for assistance and added that the amount given to her office was beyond what she expected from the Chinese Embassy. 'Eery time when Lesotho's days are darker the government of China has always shown their true friendship to Basotho people and given their sympathy,' she said.She mentioned that the amount would be used to implement and assist the proposed community income generating projects such as raising funds to support orphans and people living with HIV/AIDS.She disclosed that several village support groups had shown interest to establish projects such as bakeries, piggery, children's projects, making candles and others.She disclosed that it was not the first time her office got assistance from the Chinese Embassy, adding that the Embassy once bought school uniform for 20 orphans living in several villages across Lesotho.by Thabang LokoCopyright Mopheme/The Survior. Distributed by All Africa GlobalMedia(AllAfrica.com)KEYWORD:          Lesotho.Document afnws00020030825dz8p00466//8月14日，中国使馆向莱索托第一夫人办公室捐赠33745马洛蒂，莱索托首相莫西西里夫人表示，对中国政府为莱索托人民脱贫的无私帮助表示非常感谢。将用这笔经费从事慈善事业，支持几所村庄建立诸如面包房、养猪场、制蜡作坊、儿童项目等。

title: Construction of an international conference center (Duplicate)
description: ANTANANARIVO, July 29 (Reuters) - China and Madagascar have signed four deals worth roughly $78 million for hotel construction and debt alleviation among other things, Malagasy officials said. The deals confirmed agreements made at the China-Africa summit in Beijing last November between the Asian powerhouse and the enormous, mineral-rich island. 'The deals cover partial debt cancellation, an agreement on economic and technical cooperation, a preferential loan for the construction of a five-star hotel, and finally a deal for a donation of medicines,' said Misa Irodia, director of bilateral cooperation at the ministry of foreign affairs. The deals were worth a total of nearly $78 million, he told journalists late on Saturday. China was also building an international conference centre, and helping with preparations for the Indian Ocean Games which take place in Madagascar next month, he said. An incipient mining boom on the vast island is set to include nickel, cobalt, bauxite and ilmenite -- a source of titanium dioxide -- in the coming years. Explorers are also looking for oil, gold, coal, chromium, gemstones, and uranium. MADAGASCAR-CHINA/|LANGEN|Z|ABN|E|RBN|D|C|MTL|AFN|RNP|DNP|PCO
sector: Trade, Tourism, Banking and Financial Services

title: Contract to supply port with cranes-- not a project
description: on April 18, 2004 the Chinese company ZPMC won a 1.5bn-shilling tender to supply the Kenya Ports Authority [KPA] with eight gantry cranes. The contract stipulates 14 months to supply KPA with two ship-to-shore gantry cranes, two rail-mounted gantry cranes and four with rubber tires. In response to the announcement, KPA's Corporate Communications Officer Mr Harry Abok said the acquisition of the cranes would help the parastatal cope with increasing container traffic  The contract contains some controversy- mainly accusations of corruption in how Kenyan officials handled the bidding process for the contract. The ministers implicated were Mukhisa Kituyi (trade and industry), Prof Anyang Nyong'o (national planning) and John Michuki (transport and communications, all of whom appeared before a Public Investments Committee chaired by Mbita MP Otieno Kajwang'.
sector: Trade, Tourism, Banking and Financial Services

title: PPIAF - Roads (Public works) portion of the second phase of 2004 two bln loan from Exim Bank of China (went for project 38)
description: (PPIAF) This is financing for project 38On March 2, 2004 the first Credit Accord with the Eximbank of China was signed for a financial package of two billion US Dollars and meant for the financing of projects of Angola's public investment. The first package was implemented in two different phases, with each taking one billion US Dollars. The first phase involved 27 contracts, corresponding to 50 projects, of which 21 have  been completed. These projects focused on areas of electricity, water, health, education, public works, each of which taking about 20 percent of the total amount released.The second phase included 13 contracts and 52 projects that are underway. These contracts are in the areas of telecommunications, fisheries, health, education and public works.A contract is near approval to complete the second phase. The contract is called EDEL III, plus another two in final stage of negotiation, also in the sector of electricity and waters.The balance at the end of September 2007, according to the Finance Ministry, is of Usd 7.1 million, of which Usd 1.6 million are for the first phase of the financing and Usd 5.4 million for the second phase.The total amount disbursed until the end of September is Usd 932.9 million, being 733.1 million for the first phase and 199.8 for the second phase.As a result of the positive evaluation made by the two parties concerning the first package of two billion US Dollars, a memorandum of understanding was signed on June 20, 2006, between the Angolan Finance Ministry and China's Eximbank, for the granting of a new financing of the same amount.; Contractor Comment: Tied to the loan, is the agreement that the public tenders for the construction and civil engineering contracts will be awarded primarily to Chinese state-owned enterprises approved by the Chinese government. Exim Bank has compiled a list of 3; Political/Resource Considerations: Oil (China was to receive 10,000 barrels of oil per day. Sinopec wins a license for a large oil-production block previously held by Total of France. Sinopec then formed a joint venture to bid on other oilfields in Angola.); PPIAF-ID:17
donor_agency: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency

title: Rural School (Duplicate)
description: '应刚果共和国总统萨苏的邀请，国务院总理温家宝于6月19-20日访问了刚果共和国。　　19日下午当地时间15时，温家宝总理的专机抵达布拉柴维尔国际机场，温总理一行在机场受到刚总统萨苏、总理姆武巴和政府各部部长的热烈欢迎。在机场举行了隆重的欢迎仪式，我驻刚果共和国大使馆工作人员、在刚中资机构、援刚医疗队、华人华侨代表也到机场欢迎温总理一行。温总理在萨苏总统的陪同下驱车前往人民宫与萨苏总统会谈。沿途刚果民众手舞鲜花和中刚两国国旗，欢迎温总理到访，表达刚果人民对中国人民的友好情谊。　　温总理在机场发表的书面讲话说：中刚建交42年来，两国关系经受住了时间和国际风云变幻的考验，一直稳步发展。两国人民始终真诚友好，平等相待，互相支持，结下了深厚友谊。近年来，在两国领导人的共同关心和推动下，中刚友好关系焕发出新的活力，各领域的合作成果显著，我们对此感到高兴。我希望这次访问将进一步增进相互了解，扩大经贸合作，推动中刚友好合作关系迈上新的台阶。　　温总理在与萨苏总统会谈时说：我一踏上贵国的土地，就深深感受到刚果人民对中国人民的友好情谊。沿街夹道欢迎的情景十分感人。这种质朴的热情再次表明中刚关系有着坚实的基础。这种基础来源于两国42年来始终真诚相待，在维护国家主权和振兴民族经济的事业中相互支持、相互帮助，结下了浓厚的友谊。正是由于中刚关系日益密切，去年总统阁下提出两国建立战略伙伴关系的建议，中方对此表示赞同。中方从战略高度重视中刚关系的持续发展，愿与刚方共同努力，推动两国在各领域的务实合作。为此，中方希望加强双边政治磋商，探讨政府援助与企业合作并行的合作模式，开展人文交流。为帮助刚果经济、社会发展，中国政府决定再向刚方提供3000万元人民币无偿援助，赠送抗疟药品，援建农业示范中心和乡村学校，提供专业技术人员培训等。　　萨苏总统说：中刚建交42年来，中国一直真诚地帮助刚果，对此，刚果人民永远不会忘记。中国是刚果的伟大朋友。同中国建立战略伙伴关系，是刚果的必然选择，因为两国不仅有传统的友谊，而且在许多重大国际问题上有完全一致的立场。刚方愿继续深化与中国的政治、经济合作，加强双方在联合国等多边机构以及在重大国际和地区问题上协调与配合。　　双方还就非洲形势交换了意见。温总理对萨苏总统担任非盟轮值主席以来，为维护非洲团结和解决地区热点问题所作的积极努力表示赞赏。他说，中方重视加强与非盟的合作。为支持非盟在苏丹达尔富尔的维和行动，中国政府决定向非盟提供１００万美元现汇援助，还将通过双边渠道向达尔富尔地区紧急提供２０００万元人民币人道援助。中方将一如既往地支持非盟加强自身建设，希望非盟在促进地区和平与发展问题上发挥更大的作用。萨苏表示，非洲国家和人民有能力解决自己的问题。非洲感谢中国在解决苏丹达尔富尔等该地区热点问题上发挥的积极作用，希望中国继续关心非洲和平与发展问题。　　会谈后，温总理与萨苏总统共同出席了两国经济技术合作协定等双边经贸合作文件的签字仪式并共同会见了记者。双方还发表了联合公报。　　中国商务部部长薄熙来与刚果负责计划、国土整治、经济一体化和非洲新伙伴计划的国务部长皮埃尔·穆萨签署了《中华人民共和国商务部和刚果共和国计划、国土整治、经济一体化和非洲新伙伴计划部关于两国经贸合作特殊安排的框架协议》，薄熙来部长还与刚外交与法语国家事务国务部长鲁道夫·阿达达签署了《中华人民共和国政府和刚果共和国政府经济技术合作协定》等共7个经贸协议。中国进出口银行行长李若谷与刚经财部长伊索伊卡贝签署了刚果共和国政府和中国进出口银行关于购买新舟60飞机的优惠贷款协议。　　签字仪式后，国务院总理温家宝在布拉柴维尔议会大厦草坪与刚总理姆武巴共同种植了一棵中刚友谊树，然后会见了刚果总理姆武巴。　　温总理说，友谊产生力量，正是由于两国人民有着牢固的友谊，中刚关系才得以不断深入发展。　　温总理指出，经贸关系是两国关系的重要组成部分。中刚经贸合作建立在平等互利基础之上，因而是可持续的，有利于两国经济的发展。中刚在经济上有较强的互补性，合作潜力巨大。中刚在多年的合作中摸索出一些经验，极大地提高了两国经贸合作的水平。中方将鼓励中资公司到刚果投资兴业，要求它们不断提高合作的质量和效益，多从事公益事业，保护好当地的环境，实现互利共赢。　　姆武巴总理说，中国在刚果最困难的时候伸出了援助之手，患难见真情，刚果人民永远将中国人民视为自己最值得信赖的亲兄弟。今天，刚中两国对和平与发展的共同追求使两国关系日益紧密。在刚果，刚中友好已深入人心，两国合作的结晶随处可见。刚方重视刚中关系，将积极采取措施落实双方已签署的各项协议，并欢迎中国企业来刚投资，开展多种形式的合作。　　温总理说，中方赞赏刚果政府坚定奉行一个中国政策，支持中国和平统一大业。目前非洲仍有６个国家同台湾保持所谓“外交关系”，中国与这些国家既无历史纠葛，亦无遗留问题，更未做过任何损害其利益的事情。我们愿意在和平共处五项原则基础上同这些国家建立正常的关系，希望它们尽早认识到发展同中国关系的重要性，回到一个中国的立场上来。　　姆武巴总理重申刚果政府恪守一个中国的原则，反对任何形式的“台独”。希望尚未与中国建交的非洲国家顺应时代潮流，尽快承认一个中国的原则。　　当晚，温总理在下榻的饭店亲切会见了中国驻刚果（布）使馆工作人员、中资机构、医疗队和华侨代表。　　20日上午温总理来到位于布拉柴维尔市区的达朗盖医院。该医院自创立以来，中国医疗队就在这里工作。温总理到达医院时受到刚中两国医务工作者的热烈欢迎。温总理走进病房看望了患者，并会见了中国医疗队员代表和刚果医务人员代表。　　温总理对中国医疗队队员表示慰问。他说，中国医疗队队员远离家乡和亲人，不远万里来到非洲大陆，不畏艰难困苦，忘我奉献，发扬救死扶伤的人道主义精神。你们精湛的医术和高尚的医德，受到了当地人民的赞扬，搭建了中刚人民友谊的桥梁，为中刚友好合作关系做出了积极贡献，为祖国赢得了荣誉。你们不仅是救死扶伤的白衣天使，而且是传播中非友谊、促进中非合作的友好使者。　　温总理强调指出，中国政府高度重视中刚卫生合作。为表示对刚果（布）人民防治疟疾工作的支持，中国政府此次向刚果（布）政府赠送价值２００万元人民币的抗疟药，并将继续向刚果（布）派遣医疗队。最后，温总理在赠送仪式上，向刚果政府赠送了药品，向中国医疗队工作的两个医院赠送了药品和电脑。　　随后，温总理来到布拉柴维尔中学参观，受到该校全体师生的热烈欢迎，学生们用汉语向温总理问候。温家宝总理走进教室与在该校学习汉语的学生进行了亲切交谈，并走上讲台，在黑板上写下了“海内存知己，天涯若比邻”这句中国名言，向同学们认真地进行了讲解。　　温总理表示，中刚教育合作十分活跃，每年都有３０多名刚果（布）留学生在中国学习。在布拉柴学校也曾有中国教师工作过。中国政府愿继续加强两国的教育交流与合作。为支持刚果（布）教育事业的发展，中方将为刚果（布）建设一所乡村学校。　　温总理说，语言是连接友谊的纽带。他希望同学们学好汉语，成为服务于刚果（布）国家和人民的有用之材，成为增进中刚人民了解和友谊的桥梁。　　参观时，温总理还向学校赠送了电脑、书籍和学习用品。　　在圆满结束对刚果共和国的访问之后，温总理于20日上午10时30分乘坐专机离开布拉柴维尔国际机场前往安哥拉。刚果总统萨苏、总理姆武巴以及各部部长等到机场欢送温总理一行。机场上举行了隆重的欢送仪式。中国驻刚果大使馆工作人员、中资机构代表等也到机场欢送温总理一行。 '

title: Business Park Construction (Duplicate of 1153)
description: China's Tianli Group to build 500 mln usd business park in Mauritius104 words15 March 2007AFX AsiaAFXASIEnglish(c) 2007, AFX Asia. All rights reserved.PORT LOUIS (XFN-ASIA) - China's Tianli Group has gained approval to build a 500 mln usd business park targeted at Chinese businesses in Mauritius, the Mauritian finance ministry said.The 210-hectare park leased from the government will be built in an industrial zone north of the capital and will directly create 5,000 local jobs, the minister, Ramakrisna Sithanen, told Agence France-Presse.The project will also lead to the creation of another 2,500 jobs indirectly and 8,000 jobs for Chinese contract workers, said Sithanen.afpMMMMDocument AFXASI0020070315e33f000mi山西省在毛里求斯建设天利（毛里求斯）经济贸易合作区项目获商务部批准 2006-11-17 14:46  文章来源：山西省商务厅文章类型：原创  内容分类：新闻　　国家在十一五期间为推动和引导国内生产能力较大，竞争优势较强的企业对外投资将建立10个对外经济贸易合作区，这也是商务部十一五期间推动“走出去”实现跨越式发展的工作重点。　　近日，我省在毛里求斯建设天利（毛里求斯）经济贸易合作区项目已获商务部批准，这个项目是从全国66个预选项目中经过投标、竞标、陈述、专家评审、商务部党组研究并征得外交部同意后取得的。同时也是胡锦涛主席在中非论坛讲话中提出的在非洲建三到五个合作区之一。该合作区将由山西省天利实业有限公司负责建设、管理和运营，省商务厅负责监管、协调。合作区总投资7.66亿元人民币，分五年建成规划面积2平方公里，建设纺织服装园、机电园、轻工园、高新技术园、食品加工园等5个工业园区和职工生活服务区。商务部将给予2亿元的资金补贴支持。　　　　为了增强企业“走出去”的信心，提高企业在国际市场的竞争力，这次对入园企业在政策上也给予很大支持，商务部将给50%的厂房租赁补贴，对前往合作区投资入园企业的银行贷款在对外经济技术合作专项资金中给予5年100%的贴息，对投资项目的前期经费给予50%的补贴等。　　天利（毛里求斯）经济贸易合作区的建设给我省企业“走出去”搭建了一个很好的平台，我省企业要抓住这次机遇，结合本企业实际情况，选一批适合本企业国外发展的项目前往合作区投资。　　　　实施“走出去”战略，是我省改革开放的一项重要工作，已引起个级政府的高度重视和支持。我省各市、各企业将充分利用这次发展机遇鼓励并引导企业走出国门，开拓国际市场，为本地区的经济实现可持续发展，走向现代化强市做出贡献。                文章类型：原创　　　　　　　内容分类：新闻      天利发掘毛里求斯商机据天利纺纱(毛里求斯)有限公司董事长王安民介绍，公司在毛里求斯投资建设的三期项目得到当地政府支持，投资额将达到5500万美元。　　天利纺纱(毛里求斯)有限公司是中国山西省天利实业集团在非洲岛国毛里求斯独资建立的棉纺纱企业。自2002年3月开始对毛里求斯投资以来，天利纺纱已经完成前两期的项目建设。在二期扩建后，天利纺纱目前的生产规模达到3.5万锭，年产棉纱6486吨。　　据介绍，天利集团来到毛里求斯投资建厂，主要是看中了当地巨大的市场空间和良好的投资环境。　　出口加工业是毛里求斯的三大支柱产业之一，主要以纺织品和服装为主。毛里求斯出口加工区有200多家服装加工厂，每年需要4万到5万吨各类纱线。在天利纺纱成立前，毛里求斯国内没有一家专业棉纺纱厂，所需纱线主要从印度、巴基斯坦和中国进口。天利集团从中捕捉到了巨大商机。　　另据介绍，为了吸引外国投资，毛里求斯政府制订了多项针对出口加工区企业的优惠政策，比如企业在建厂期间进口机器设备和生产所需原材料一律免税。此外，毛里求斯属于市场经济国家，实行贸易自由化政策，给予外资企业国民待遇，没有外汇管制，资本流动比较自由。美国、欧盟、日本及不少非洲国家给予毛里求斯优惠的市场准入条件。      来源:经济参考报〔中非贸易〕中方两新投资者加入在毛里求斯7.5亿美元贸易开发区项目2009年 7月 2日 星期四 10:06 BJT  路透路易港7月1日电---毛里求斯政府周三称,两个新投资者已加入中国在毛里求斯7.5亿美元的贸易开发区.          官员称,山西省天利实业(Shanxi Tianli Enterprises)工业园是毛里求斯迄今所接受的最大外商投资,将为中国在该地区的投资提供一个平台.          该园区每年料将带来60-70亿卢比(约合1.86亿美元)的出口.          '在中国国家主席胡锦涛访问毛里求斯後,应中国政府要求,山西焦煤集团公司和太原钢铁公司已加入该项目,'毛里求斯财政部长Ramakrishna Sithanen周三对记者表示.          在稍早与山西省一代表团会谈後,Sithanen称该园区建设已被推迟至今年稍晚.          '该项目因为全球经济低迷而被推迟,但投资者仍将遵守承诺.将在今年年底前开工,'他说.(完)          --编译 刘兰香;审校 王露迪

title: Trade Development Zone (Duplicate of 1153)
description: Mauritius hopes China investment will spur economy416 words17 May 200702:20 AMReuters NewsLBAEnglish(c) 2007 Reuters LimitedSHANGHAI, May 17 (Reuters) - The grimy, polluted northern Chinese mining province of Shanxi is a world away from the palm-fringed beaches of Mauritius.But the government of the Indian Ocean island is signing a $500 million deal with Shanxi Tianli Enterprises Ltd. to build a trade development zone that it hopes will help to transform its roughly $6 billion economy. 'It's the biggest single investment that Mauritius has ever known in its history -- $500 million and they're starting this year,' Deputy Prime Minister Rama Sithanen said on Thursday. Sithanen said the five-year project, which is projected to generate 7,500 jobs and $200 million of exports a year, is the sort of foreign investment the government wants to attract as part of a 4 billion euro ($5.41 billion) plan to overhaul the economy over the next decade. Mauritius expects to fund half of the programme domestically -- from private investment or budget outlays -- and half from abroad, primarily from the European Union and international financial institutions including the World Bank, the African Development Bank (AFDB) and France's development agency, he said.Speaking on the sidelines of the annual meeting of the AFDB, Sithanen said commercial borrowing would obviously have to make up any shortfall.But he said he had no timetable for trying to tap the financial markets and wanted to avoid doing so given Mauritius's relatively high debt level as a share of GDP.'The less that we borrow from the market, the better it is in terms of debt sustainability,' said Sithanen, who is also finance and economic planning minister.Mauritius is struggling to overcome what Sithanen called a triple trade shock -- the end of preferential trade deals in its key sugar and textile sectors as well as a spike in the price of oil.Local businessmen have voiced concern about delays and possible backtracking on reforms that Sithanen launched last June to guide Mauritius through European sugar price cuts of 36 percent over four years.But Sithanen cited Shanxi Tianli's choice of Mauritius for its industrial park as evidence that the island, by cutting tax and red tape, was becoming a better place to do business.'It was a beauty contest. We had to compete,' said Sithanen, who will fly to Shanxi after the AFDB meeting to sign the deal. ($1=.7394 Euro)MAURITIUS-CHINA/|LANGEN|Z|ABN|E|RBN|M|D|AFN|ABX|RNP|DNPDocument LBA0000020070517e35h000iz

title: Financing of the Cahora Bassa Dam
description: A memorandum of understanding on Cahora Bassa was signed in Lisbon in November 2006, under which the shareholding structure of the dam operating company, HCB, would be changed. Currently the Portuguese state holds 82 per cent of the shares, and Mozambique just 18 per cent. Under the November arrangement the positions would be reversed, with Mozambique holding 85 per cent of the HCB shares, and Portugal 15 per cent. China will pay not Mozambique's debt to Portugal, arising from the transfer of the Cahora Bassa dam on the Zambezi from Portuguese to Mozambican majority ownership. The sum is around 950 million US dollars, and some reports have appeared that the Chinese Exim Bank (represented on the delegation) will pay this sum.  China is financing the Mphanda Nkua Damn.

title: China offers Technicians (Duplicate of 1211)
description: Daily Main Book - NewsThis massive invasion will benefit the continentIan Birrell707 words15 October 2009The IndependentIND1ST22,23English(c) 2009 Independent   Media PLCNews | CommentEach week, the Centre for Chinese Studies at Stellensbosch University in South Africa issues an update on China's activities in Africa. The latest issue is typical: one company has finished a bridge in Angola, another is building an agricultural research centre in Mozambique, and direct investment in the first six months of the year stood at £345m, nearly twice that of the same period last year.The bulletin highlights the pace of China's scramble for Africa, arguably the most important geo-political change since the fall of the Berlin wall. When the Chinese turned to Africa in 1996 to provide the raw materials to fuel their astonishing growth, trade between the two was worth a paltry £3.5bn. Last year it stood at £66bn, with hundreds of Chinese companies operating on the continent. India, South Korea and other Asian countries are following in their wake.The focus is on the resources that should have made Africa rich: oil from Angola, gas from Nigeria, copper from Zambia, cobalt from the Congo. Beijing is even hoping Africa can help feed the growing Chinese population, buying up precious agricultural land and investing in research projects. In Mozambique, for example, China has offered £500m to modernise farming infrastructure, together with financing a canal and sending over more than 100 agricultural experts to help improve crop yields.The Chinese are not just plundering Africa's natural resources. They have built roads, railways, schools and stadiums. Shops are filled with Chinese-made goods; look closely and you will find that even some traditional African fabrics on sale in the markets are made in China. You will also notice a lack of Western goods on sale.With this relationship comes political, diplomatic and strategic power, strengthening China's hand in foreign policy and on international bodies - the 53 nations in Africa comprise more than a quarter of the UN General Assembly.China's policy of ignoring human rights issues has led it into deals with some of the more unsavoury figures on the continent. Many view it as a malign influence, propping up Robert Mugabe and, for a long time, refusing to put pressure on Sudan over Darfur. The loathsome offer to the Guinea junta will underline such fears.There are other problems with the Chinese invasion. Some are minor: visiting Mali three years ago, a new electronic scoreboard in Bamako's football stadium was on display. Unfortunately, it was out of order since the Chinese contractors had returned home and the instructions were in Mandarin.Others are more serious. Cheap Chinese goods are stifling African markets. And many Chinese companies win contracts by paying low wages, bribing officials and ignoring environmental concerns. Some deals insist that the majority of work goes to Chinese companies or that a majority of the workforce is Chinese, hindering development and angering residents who see much-needed jobs go to immigrants. Resentment is growing to such an extent in some areas that politicians have campaigned on anti-Chinese sentiment.For all these justified concerns, however, the Chinese are ultimately benefiting Africa. They are offering vital competition to Western companies and finance for African nations. Their insatiable demand for raw materials has forced prices up, meaning more money flows into the continent. And, most importantly, they are ensuring the rapid development of infrastructure, something that is desperately needed and has been ignored for decades by the West.The West must be wary of hypocrisy, given its own record. In recent weeks we have seen one British company involved in a massive bribery case in Tanzania and another accused of dumping toxic waste in the Iory Coast. And, of course, Western nations are not immune to propping up their own favoured despots.Instead, we should push for greater transparency to eliminate corruption and tighter regulations to protect the environment. But it is little wonder that Paul Kagame, the dynamic President of Rwanda, defended China this week. 'The Chinese bring what Africa needs: investment and money for governments and companies,' he said. 'I would prefer the Western world to invest in Africa rather than handing out development aid.'i.birrell@independent.co.uk

title: More duty free items can go from Mozambique to China
description: In February of 2007, Chinese President Hu Jintao announced that the amount of duty free goods allowed into China from Mozambique would increase from 190 to 442. The change took place fairly quickly in trade agreements. Information on specific monetary amounts affected, specific people involved, and planning dates are yet to be found. STAFF_NOTES: Preferential tariffs do not count as a development project, and therefore this record has been deactivated.

title: China to Build National Stadium for Mozambique Inactive
description: The Chinese government is to finance the construction of a national stadium for Mozambique with the capacity to hold 42,000 spectators, the Minister of Youth and Sport, David Simango, announced on Saturday.The new stadium will be totally financed by China, and built by a Chinese company, in the outlying Maputo suburb of Zimpeto.It will be the second largest stadium in the country, after the Machava stadium, which is also on the outskirts of the capital, and was built during the colonial period.The contract for building the stadium was signed between the Permanent Secretary in the Ministry of Youth and Sport, Joao Loforte, and the head of the Chinese technical team, Lu Xiao Ming, which worked in Zimpeto for the past three weeks, identifying the site for the stadium and gathering other relevant data. Within the next 30 days, the Mozambican government must supply other information requested by the Chinese team. Then the Chinese will have three months to present a draft project to Simango's Ministry.Analysis of the project by the Mozambican side, any alterations to it, and the launch of a tender in China to choose the contractor will take up to the end of June 2007.'Building work will begin in the second half of next year', said Simango. 'If everything goes according to plan the National Stadium will be ready by the end of 2009, at the latest'.Chinese ambassador Hong Hong, who witnessed the signing, pledged 'we shall carry out the project as planned'He said it represented the aspirations of Mozambican youth and sportspeople, and was a symbol of the friendship between the Mozambican and Chinese peoples.

title: China lends Mozambique development capital Inactive
description: China lends Mozambique another R418.6-m103 words4 March 2009FT NowFTNOWEnglish(c) 2009 Now Media (Pty) Ltd. All Rights Reserved.The Mozambiquan and Chinese governments signed three agreements in Maputo, under which China is to provide a total of R418.6-million in loan and grant finance. News agency AIM reports that the largest sum is a loan of R224.2-m for the fourth funding phase in the construction of Mozambique's new national sports stadium. A second loan, for R183.6-m, is to support agricultural projects in the Zambezi Valley, while the third agreement is for a grant of R30.6-m to be used in basic development sectors yet to be identified.

title: Chinese Gov Donates Equipment to Mozambique Armed Forces- duplicate with 1191
description: Chinese Aid for Mozambican Armed Forces200 words21 May 200710:18 AMAll AfricaAFNWSEnglish(c) 2007 AllAfrica, All Rights Reserved Maputo, May 21, 2007 (Agencia de Informacao de Mocambique/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) -- The Chinese government on Saturday donated equipment valued at 1.5 million U.S. dollars to the Mozambican armed forces (FADM).   Chinese ambassador Tiang Guafeng delivered the donation, including seven light vehicles, 31 computers, and assorted uniforms for the Mozambican army, navy and air force, to Defence Minister Tobias Dai. At the ceremony, Dai said that the Chinese grant will improve the logistical capacity of the FADM to face successfully future natural disasters. (The most prominent role of the FADM in recent years has consisted of missions to rescue victims of floods and cyclones.) 'Once the capacities of the FADM are increased', said Dai, 'the armed forces will consolidate their position as primary actors in removing adversities, thus contributing to strengthening the Mozambican state, and pursuing the national development agenda'. Ambassador Tiang stressed that China attributes great importance to strengthening Sino-Mozambican relations in the area of defence.

Specifically, the projects would target mining in Tete province, Maravia district. Reports appear to corroborate this details, but no further information has been found. Implementation has not begun as of September 2012.

title: Tong Jian may invest in Maputo port expansion
description: The Chinese investment firm, Tong Jian, will invest $10 billion US dollars in Mozambique's province of Sofala. These projects include hotels (duplicate #1238), car assembly plant (duplicate #1239), and the realm of port and air transport expansion. As for the latter, the investment company may put $1.7 billion US dollars into the improvement of the main port in Maputo. As of September 2012, the Maputo port was still seeking funding. The construction will involve refurbishing the the road and rail lines to the port and creating larger terminals. By 2018, they hope to increase traffic by twice as much as the port currently sees.The end of year 2012 should see an increase of 30% on its own. Exact start dates on the implementation process and contacts involved remain unknown.

title: Equity to Kenyan Banks (duplicate with ID: 1264)
description: 'Nairobi, May 24, 2010 (The East African/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) -- Barely a fortnight after President Mwai Kibaki visited China to scout for development support, the Asian economic powerhouse has come calling with a $4 billion fund that will be loaned to small and medium enterprises through Equity Bank.Kenya becomes the first country in Africa to benefit from the $5 billion Chinese fund for the development of small and medium enterprises (SMEs) on the continent.'It reflects the growing relationship between Kenya and China,' said the governor and CEO of China Development Bank Jiang Chaoliang when he signed the facility in Nairobi last week.'This signing signifies South to South co-operation and collaboration to address our common challenges,' he added, signifying an increase in China's investment in the country.Equity Bank managing director James Mwangi said it has taken the institution, that bears the tag of the poor man's bank, close to three years to negotiate the long-term facility with the China Development Bank.The development is expected to spur the SME sector which plays a crucial role in social economic development. It also comes a fortnight after banks in Kenya started reducing base lending rates, a move that was spearheaded by Barclays Bank that revised its levels to 10 per cent.The Chinese loans will be available to SMEs at interest rates of between seven and nine per cent for periods of three to seven years making it one of cheapest source of financing in the country.Equity also announced a revision of its base lending rates down to 12 per cent and said that those seeking the Chinese funds will borrow at between one and three points lower than the base rate.ChallengesLack of access to affordable credit is recognised as one of the key challenges facing the development of the SME sector in the country, retarding growth, squeezing profitability and limiting its ability to contribute effectively to national development.Mr Mwangi said the SME sector in Kenya faced the challenge of high cost of credit, high bank charges and fees, limiting their potential to contribute to the country's Gross Domestic Product and the attainment of the goals of Vision 2030, Kenya's economic growth blueprint.The China Development Bank has been studying Equity Bank with a view of learning the Equity model of banking and its sustainability for rural China.On its part, Equity Bank has been seeking funding and transfer of low cost housing technology and long-tern funding for SMEs.The China Development Bank is the biggest such institution in the world with over $97 billion in assets, larger than all other world development banks put together.Equity also lends to farmers through Kilimo Biashara at 10 per cent rate of interest and to the youth at 8 per cent interest.Equity Bank's business model has attracted both local and international recognition, with its CEO being invited to address some high global profile gatherings such as the G8 Summit, where heads of the world's richest nations sit to plan the future of the rest.Equity Bank leapt into the big boys club in the banking sector in 2007 by a massive capital injection of Ksh11 billion ($142.8 million) from Helios EB International, a strategic investor that bought a quarter of its shareholding.The former took up a 25 per cent stake in Kenya's fastest growing bank, by acquiring over 90 million new shares, making it the single largest shareholder, and doubled Equity's capitalisation to Ksh22 billion ($285.6 million)International muscleIt was the biggest ever such transaction in Kenya's banking history. Helios' entry brought international muscle to the bank, being the home of respected big-name investors and funds, such as the UK government-owned CDC Group, United States OPIC, Soros Funds Management, and International Finance Corporation, the World Bank's private sector lending arm. '
sector: Trade, Tourism, Banking and Financial Services

recipient_agencies: China Development Bank (CDB), Government Agency

title: Medical teams sent to Namibia
description: During the visit, the Chinese president will meet with his Namibian counterpart Hifikepunye Pohamba and Namibia's former president Sam Nujoma.Namibia has always been an all-weather friend to China. Nujoma, currently the president of the ruling SWAPO-PARTY (South West African People's Organization) and also the first president of Namibia, has visited China 13 times. Pohamba visited China and met with President Hu during the Beijing Summit of the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation (FOCAC) last November.Since China and Namibia established diplomatic ties in 1990, bilateral exchanges and cooperation between the two countries have developed in numerous areas, including politics, economy, education and health.China had offered great help to Namibia during its struggle for liberation before independence, while over the years, the Namibian government has consistently adhered to the one-China policy.To accelerate Namibia's economic and social development and further promote bilateral trade and economic ties, China has provided assistance without any political preconditions to Namibia by constructing child centres, low-cost apartments, etc.Two-way trade has developed very fast in recent years with the volume reaching 240 million US dollars during the first 11 months of 2006. It is expected to reach 280 million dollars for the full year.Meanwhile, an increasing number of Chinese enterprises are entering the markets of the southern African country, contributing to local economic development and helping to improve living standards.The two countries have maintained good cooperation in health and education. The Chinese government has sent medical teams and teachers to work in Namibia. It has also annually provided training courses and scholarships to Namibians to study in China.Liang Yinzhu, the Chinese Ambassador to Namibia, recently told Xinhua that Sino-Namibian relations are expected to enter a new stage with a wider scale, higher level and broader areas under the spirit of the Beijing Summit of the FOCAC.Source: Xinhua news agency, Beijing, in English 0428 gmt 4 Feb 07

title: Teachers sent to Namibia
description: Text of report in English by official Chinese news agency Xinhua (New China News Agency)Windhoek, Feb. 4 (Xinhua) - Chinese President Hu Jintao is scheduled to pay a state visit to Namibia on Feb. 5-6, which is expected to further promote the bilateral ties of the two countries.During the visit, the Chinese president will meet with his Namibian counterpart Hifikepunye Pohamba and Namibia's former president Sam Nujoma.Namibia has always been an all-weather friend to China. Nujoma, currently the president of the ruling SWAPO-PARTY (South West African People's Organization) and also the first president of Namibia, has visited China 13 times. Pohamba visited China and met with President Hu during the Beijing Summit of the Forum on China-Africa Cooperation (FOCAC) last November.Since China and Namibia established diplomatic ties in 1990, bilateral exchanges and cooperation between the two countries have developed in numerous areas, including politics, economy, education and health.China had offered great help to Namibia during its struggle for liberation before independence, while over the years, the Namibian government has consistently adhered to the one-China policy.To accelerate Namibia's economic and social development and further promote bilateral trade and economic ties, China has provided assistance without any political preconditions to Namibia by constructing child centres, low-cost apartments, etc.Two-way trade has developed very fast in recent years with the volume reaching 240 million US dollars during the first 11 months of 2006. It is expected to reach 280 million dollars for the full year.Meanwhile, an increasing number of Chinese enterprises are entering the markets of the southern African country, contributing to local economic development and helping to improve living standards.The two countries have maintained good cooperation in health and education. The Chinese government has sent medical teams and teachers to work in Namibia. It has also annually provided training courses and scholarships to Namibians to study in China.Liang Yinzhu, the Chinese Ambassador to Namibia, recently told Xinhua that Sino-Namibian relations are expected to enter a new stage with a wider scale, higher level and broader areas under the spirit of the Beijing Summit of the FOCAC.Source: Xinhua news agency, Beijing, in English 0428 gmt 4 Feb 07

title: Not a project: Training of professionals
description: Text of report in English by official Chinese news agency Xinhua (New China News Agency) ['Chinese, Ethiopian FMs Hold Talks on Bilateral Cooperation' - Xinhua headline] ADDIS ABABA, Jan. 11 (Xinhua) - Chinese Foreign Minister Yang Jiechi and his Ethiopian counterpart Seyoum Mesfin held talks Friday and vowed to boost bilateral cooperation. During their talks, both Yang and Seyoum spoke highly of bilateral friendly cooperation. The two sides agreed to make joint efforts to push forward the all-round cooperative partnership between China and Africa in the following areas: First, to maintain the momentum for high-level contacts, enhance mutual political trust and continue mutual support and coordination on key issues. Ethiopia reaffirms its stance to firmly stick to the one-China policy. Second, to explore and expand economic and trade cooperation. The project of China's Oriental Industrial Park, set up in Ethiopia, shall be completed as soon as possible. Ethiopia welcomes Chinese firms to invest in the country and take part in its telecommunications and infrastructure construction projects. Ethiopia will guarantee the safety of Chinese firms and their staff members. Third, to increase personnel and cultural exchanges and cooperation. China encourages personnel exchanges and will help Ethiopia train more professionals. China will send the third batch of youth volunteers to work in Ethiopia. China will fully implement the aid projects involving a hospital, three rural schools and an agricultural technology demonstration centre. Fourth, to strengthen political consultation between the two foreign ministries so as to keep close coordination and cooperation in both regional and international affairs. The two sides also exchanged views on Sudan's Darfur and Somalia issues. Chinese Foreign Minister Yang stressed China follows closely African hotspots, upholding the policy of solving African armed conflicts through peaceful means as dialogue and consultation. Yang said China would continue to work together with the United Nations, the African Union (AU) and African countries concerned to play a constructive role in solving the above issues at an early date and promoting lasting peace, stability and development of African countries concerned and African continent as a whole. Yang and Seyoum signed an agreement on economic and technological cooperation following the talks. They also answered questions from media. Before his talks with Seyoum, Yang also met with Sufian Ahmed, Ethiopia's minister of finance and economic development, and exchanged views on some cooperative projects. Yang and his entourage arrived here Thursday on the last leg of his four-nation African tour, which also took him to South Africa, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Burundi. Source: Xinhua news agency, Beijing, in English 1752 gmt 11 Jan 08

title: Construction of power plant (not a project)
description: By Tesfa Alem Tekle March 18, 2010 ( ADDIS ABABA ) - As nation once again plunges in to major power crises, Ethiopia power Utility signs a new contract agreement with a Chinese company to build a new hydro power project as part of the country's long term commitment to meet growing power demand. . The agreement for the construction Genale Dawa 3 power plant was signed between Ethiopia Electric and Power Corporation (EEPCO) and Chinese Gezhouba group company (CGGC) After a water passage tunnel of a recently inaugurated power plant (Gilgel Gibe II) was partly collapsed, EEPCO has once again began a nationwide power rationing. Power consuming big factories such as cement plants, metal and plastic ones are made to reduce their power consumption, highly impacting on their production. The new power project will be constructed at a cost of 480 million US Dollars and it will have a power generating capacity of 254 MW up on completion within the next five years.Genale power plant is said to boost country's power capacity by 25%. The horn of Africa's nation has earmarked 12 billion dollars of investment to its 25 year power sector master plan. With other power projects being in progress, currently six hydro power plants supply 1000 MW, while country's power demand stands at 1200 MW. Speaking to parliament, Ethiopian Prime Minister Meles Zenawi today said that country's power problems will be solved in the next few weeks. (ST)

title: $300m loan for Telecom projects
description: In 2002, Nigeria committed to a rural telephone development project with a $300 million soft loan from China. The first phase of the project covered 117 local governments, and the second phase 125 local council areas. The first and second phases were funded by a $200 million Export-Import Bank of China loan. Nigeria negotiated another $100 loan for the third phase, which covered over 150 local government areas.The project was expected to begin in 2003, created 200,000 telephone lines, and was aimed at providing voice, video, and data telecommunication equipment. The construction contract was awarded to Shanghai Bell and ZTE. Associated projects: #1705, #13626, #1718

title: 1,000 Housing Units and Hotel
description: In 2002, UNIGLOBAL agreed to construct 1,000 housing units and a five star hotel in Kebbi State, estimated to cost over N5 billion. UNIGLOBAL coordinator Alhaji Abdullahi Baye explained the housing units would help Nigeria's housing problem by providing affordable rent and provide job opportunities. UNIGLOBAL has secured a financial guarantee for the projects. The status of the project is unknown.
donor_agency_count: UNIGLOBAL Nigeria Limited, Private Sector
recipient_agencies: UNIGLOBAL Nigeria Limited, Private Sector

title: China Guangdong Nuclear Power for Extract Resources stake in uranium
description: In 2011, a leading Chinese nuclear power company acquired a stake in a Namibian uranium deposit. Chinese state-owned firm CGNPC Uranium Resources Co. took over the mine in a $1.22 billion deal.On Monday, the board of Kalahari Minerals PLC (KAH.LN) said it will recommend that shareholders accept a possible offer from Chinese state-owned firm CGNPC Uranium Resources Co. to take over the miner in a GBP756 million ($1.22 billion) deal.Then Tuesday, Qian Zhimin, deputy director of China's National Energy Administration, said that China's planned construction of dozens of nuclear reactors in the next decade meant that it would overtake the U.S. in terms of uranium use.'It is a question of time. We will not have to wait long for it to be true. It should happen some time before 2030,' he told the China Daily newspaper.The China Nuclear Energy Association said last year that China planned to build more than 60 reactors by 2020, with each requiring 400 tons of uranium to start operating. China already has 13 working civil nuclear reactors with a combined annual capacity of 10.8 gigawatts.Forward planning will allow China's rising demand to be met without causing the price of uranium to surge, NEA's Qian said.'The majority of uranium deals worldwide are done through forward contracts rather than spot transactions, and China has always had a long-term plan for its uranium demand and purchases,' Qian said.China is now drafting plans for uranium purchases for the next decade, he said, declining to elaborate.The country's imports of uranium mushroomed in 2010 to 17,136 tons, up 255% from 2009, as it shipped in the raw material feedstock for its nuclear power plants and reserve stocks from Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, Namibia, Russia and Australia, data from the government statistics office show.Zhiping Yu, CGNPC-URC's managing director, said Monday his company was 'delighted to have secured the support of the Kalahari board as we believe this highlights both the attractive value of the possible offer and CGNPC-URC's status as an excellent partner for the future development of the Husab Uranium Project.'Kalahari's main asset is its nearly 43% stake in Extract Resources Ltd. (EXT.AU), and its resulting interest in the Australian company's Husab uranium prospect in Namibia, which is one of the world's largest undeveloped reserves of raw uranium.CGNPC-URC's parent, China Guangdong Nuclear Power Holdings Corp., and nuclear power developers China National Nuclear Corp. have signed a string of uranium supply deals in recent months.China Guangdong Nuclear signed a uranium trade contract with Uzbekistan's Navoi Mining   Metallurgy Combine in June 2010, and an agreement with Canada's Cameco Corp. (CCO.T, CCJ) in November last year for the supply of 29 million pounds of uranium concentrate through 2025.CNNC signed an agreement in June with Cameco involving approximately 23 million pounds of uranium concentrate supplies through 2020. It is exploring for uranium in, among others, Mongolia, Zimbabwe, Tanzania and Zambia. The company is due to ship some 700 tons of uranium a year back to China from 2011 from a mine it controls in Niger, and additional supplies from a mine in Jordan.Qian said that by 2020, nuclear power could be contributing 7%-8% of China's energy needs, which is higher than the official government target of 5%.The National Development Reform Commission, the country's economic planner, said Friday that China's nuclear power output in 2011 would be around 13% higher than last year's. -By Simon Hall, Dow Jones Newswires, +86 10 8400-7755; simon.hall@dowjones.com//Recommends offer worth 243.55 pence/share* Deal boosts China efforts to meet energy needs* Kalahari top shareholder in owner of Husab uranium mine* Kalahari shares up 3 pct, below offer price(Adds details, background)LONDON, Dec 8 (Reuters) - Kalahari Minerals, the top shareholder in one of the world's largest uranium projects, has agreed to be taken over by its state-owned Chinese suitor in a cash deal valuing it at 632 million pounds ($991 million).In a purchase that will boost China's efforts to meet its growing energy needs, China Guangdong Nuclear Power Corp (CGNPC) will pay 243.55 pence for each Kalahari share.That represents a premium of around 16 percent on the average closing price for Kalahari shares for the six months prior to March 4, before China announced its intention to bid, but it is below a current share price at around 241.6 pence, indicating a counter-offer is considered unlikely.The company said in November that it was in talks with its Chinese suitor over an offer at the 243.55 price -- below the original offer on the table when the two first began discussing a deal in March, before Japan's Fukushima nuclear disaster.In March, the two sides were in talks over a 290 pence per share offer. Efforts to cut that price level to 270 pence after Fukushima were rejected by Britain's Takeover Panel, which demanded a six month interval before a fresh offer was made.After confirming its continuing interest in Kalahari last month, CGNPC had faced a deadline of 1700 GMT on Thursday to either confirm its offer or withdraw.'In the light of the unexpected circumstances in Japan and their impact on uranium equities, the Kalahari directors recognise the altered market dynamic and subsequently view the Offer from CGNPC-URC as attractive,' Mark Hohnen, Kalahari's Executive Chairman said on Thursday.'The Kalahari directors view CGNPC-URC as an excellent partner for the realisation of the full potential of the Husab uranium project to the benefit of all stakeholders.'CGNPC, which has been seeking new sources of uranium supply, said its offer was conditional on shareholders representing at least 50 percent of shares taking up the offer. It already has letters of intent from investors representing 3.9 percent.Kalahari's key asset is a 42.74 percent interest in Extract Resources , the owner of the Husab uranium project in Namibia.Husab is potentially the second-largest uranium mine in the world. Exploration work is continuing on the project, currently the world's fourth-largest uranium-only deposit, with an updated resource estimate due next year.Under Australian rules, CGNPC would be required to make a full takeover offer once it owns more than 20 percent of Extract, but the securities regulator can grant exceptions.Trading in Extract Resources was halted in Australia on Thursday ahead of the CGNPC statement.Rio Tinto holds an 11 percent stake in Kalahari and 14 percent of Extract.Extract and Rio Tinto have been discussing combining the Husab project with Rio Tinto's neighbouring Rossing uranium mine, and analysts see the global miner potentially working with the Chinese in Namibia.Deutsche Bank is adviser to CGNPC, Azure Capital and Ambrian Partners are advising Kalahari, and Rothschild is advising Extract.(Reporting by Clara Ferreira-Marques and Matt Scuffham; Editing by Helen Massy-Beresford)

title: Emergency food aid
description: In August 2011, China announced that it would provide about $14 million in humanitarian assistance to drought affected areas in the Horn of Africa.Chinese Ambassador Gu Xiaojie said the humanitarian assistance would be provided to Ethiopia, Kenya and Djibouti, and would include about $7.7 million worth of food for Ethiopia.The status of the donation is uncertain., including more than $7 million to Ethiopia.
sector: Humanitarian and Disaster Relief and Preparation

title: China to lend Ethiopia $100 mln CHECK AMOUNT (duplicate)
description: BEIJING, No 17 (Reuters) - China is set to loan Ethiopia $100 million and donate a fleet of 90 vehicles to help the African state complete its water supply projects, the Xinhua state news agency said.China's Vice Commerce Minister Jiang Yaoping and Ethiopian Finance Minister Sufian Ahmed signed a deal for the loan on Wednesday, Xinhua said. It did not say when the money will be disbursed.The loan will help pay for deep well water projects in Ethiopia's capital Addis Ababa while the fleet of 90 vehicles -- 65 cars and 25 buses -- would be used to 'serve state guests', Xinhua said.Government leaders from both sides said the loan demonstrated good bilateral relations which would improve further with deeper trade and investment links.China's increasing reliance on Africa for oil and mineral resources, as well as diplomatic support, has been backed in recent years by more monetary aid from Beijing.A separate Xinhua report said China handed over to Ethiopia on Wednesday a modern hospital built by Beijing at a cost of 80 million yuan ($12.6 million) to 'promote friendship' between the two states.But critics say China's aid is too often tied to its investment interests and can undermine efforts to encourage clean government in Africa because it does not demand the same kind of accountability as Western aid does.China says its aid comes with no strings attached, is welcomed by African nations and has benefited millions of ordinary people. ($1 = 6.346 Chinese Yuan)(Reporting by Koh Gui Qing)

title: Major Road Network Rehabilitation Project (Duplicate of 392)
description: A report in April of 2009 stated that the vice-president of EXIM Bank would travel to Lome in May of that year to finalize plans for a CFAfr85 billion [approximately US$ 175 million] road network project. A June 2009 report stated that CFAfr85 billion had been granted from the China Exim Bank in May for 'road building and repairs (and for telecommunications).' A November 2010 report stated that China Exim had loaned Togo US$165 million in September 2009 to upgrade its road and telecommunications infrastructure. A project document released by the African Development Fund in May of 2011 referred to Chinese financed road projects as 'undergoing completion' and 'future rehabilitation.' These road projects include the construction of a dual-carriage ring-road in the capital, Lomé, running from the harbour to the Ghanaian border at Nouepe via national route one (running north), as well as work on the national route one, including new bypasses at Aledjo, Bafilo and Defale (in Kara province) and the rehabilitation of part of the Dapaong-Sinkasse road to Burkina Faso (in Savanes province).

title: China to Finance Portion of the Accra-Kumasi Road
description: Mr Wenchang said to improve on the balance of trade between them, Chinese businessmen would be encouraged to invest in the processing of most raw materials produced by Ghana for export and also contribute to the New Partnership for Africa's Development (NEPAD).He commended President Kufuor for his role as Ghana's Deputy Minister for Foreign Affairs in 1971, when China wanted to secure a seat in the United Nations (UN).Mr Wenchang extended an invitation from Chinese President Jiang Zemin to President Kufuor to visit China.President Kufuor said, the visit of Mr Wenchang marks a new beginning in the relationship between Ghana and China, which he said, has been long standing, mutually respectful and beneficial.He said the assistance by China to finance portions of the Accra-Kumasi road is a good gesture because the accidents on that road affect the country economically.President Kufuor said China's support for NEPAD is laudable because China has huge markets with potentials for Africa, which is trying to evolve its small markets on the globe under the NEPAD initiative.He accepted the invitation to visit China.Copyright Accra Mail. Distributed by All Africa Global Media(AllAfrica.com)KEYWORD:          Ghana.Document afnws00020020618dy6i0080z

title: Chinese-funded regional hospital in eastern Ghana (duplicate)
description: Roundup - China, Ghana enjoy good economic relations.by Li Tao, Sun Baoyu639 words17 November 2003Xinhua News AgencyXNEWSEnglish(c) Copyright 2003 Xinhua News AgencyACCRA, No. 18 (Xinhua) - Despite the long distance between the two countries, China and Ghana enjoy good economic relations which could date back to the early 1960s.Since 1972 when the two countries resumed their diplomatic relations, the government of China has ever since been providing both technical and financial assistance in the form of loans and grants to support the socio-economic development efforts of Ghana.According to G. D. Apatu, a senior official in the Ghanaian Finance Ministry, China has provided various financial assistance packages to Ghana in the framework of bilateral cooperation, which covers many economic sectors of Ghana, such as health, food and agriculture, education, culture, industry and roads.The National Theater and Dangme East District Hospital are two public sector projects that were funded with the funds from the Chinese government.The ship-shaped National Theater in Accra, capital of Ghana, was built about 10 years ago, and it has been playing an important role in holding different kinds of national activities of the West African country.The 2003 Model Universe competition was held in the National Theater on No. 8, which attracted models of many countries including from China and Ghana to attend.The Chinese government has agreed in principle to rehabilitate the 15,000-sq. meter theater, which is estimated to cost 20 million RMB (about 2.4 million US dollars), said Apatu.Dangme East District Hospital, also funded by the Chinese government, is located in the area of Ada, some 100 km east of Accra. Eery day, 40-50 patients could be treated in the 60-bed hospital and nowadays they don't need to go a long distance to see doctors any more.Currently, the construction of barracks of the military and police in Ghana is underway by a Chinese company, using a grant of 32 million RMB (about 3.9 million dollars) from the Chinese government. The project is expected to be completed next March.Meanwhile, the Chinese government has also agreed to provide an amount of 230 million RMB (about 28 million dollars) to finance the reconstruction of the 17.4-km Ofankor-Nsawam stretch of the Accra-Kumasi Highway. The road is of great importance to the Ghanaians as it links the southern sector to the northern sector of the country.As for the joint venture projects, the Chinese government has agreed to provide loans of some 18 million dollars to help the cooperation companies in Ghana for further development.Meanwhile, as promised in the first ministerial meeting of the China-Africa Cooperation Forum held in China in 2000, the Chinese government on June 17, 2002, canceled part of Ghana's debt to China to the tune of over 100 million RMB.So far, China has become fifth trade partner with Ghana. Ghana exports to China primary and semi-processed products such as cocoa beans and timber while importing manufactured goods, stationary, textiles and chemicals from the Asian country.Citing the good economic relations between China and Ghana, a Ghanaian trade official said recently that the upcoming second ministerial meeting of the China-Africa Cooperation Forum will provide more chances for Ghanaians to develop further cooperation with their Chinese counterparts.    'The Forum will give the Ghanaians good chances to see, totrade and explore market,' he added.   The second ministerial meeting of the China-Africa Cooperation  Forum is expected to be held on Dec. 15-16 in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, during which ministers from China and 46 forum member countries in Africa will hold discussions over the further cooperation between China and Africa in such fields as agriculture, infrastructures, investment and trade.    The first meeting was held in October 2000 in Beijing, China,to establish a cooperation system between China and Africa forcommon development.  Document XNEWS00020031118dzbh000xd

title: National Theatre in Accra [duplicate of 1498]
description: AFNWSEnglish(c) Distributed via COMTEX News.Jun 19, 2002 (Ghanaian Chronicle/All Africa Global Media via COMTEX) - THE CHINESE government has donated an amount of $8million (about o56million) to the Dangbe East constituency to build a hospital. They are also going to help in the construction of some portions of the Accra-Kumasi road.This was disclosed in Accra when China's vice Minister for Foreign Affairs in charge of Africa, H.E Yang Wenchang, held bilateral talks with Ghana's deputy Minister for Foreign Affairs, Hon. Alhaji Mustapha Ali Idris.Hon. Ali Idris expressed satisfaction on the excellent bilateral relations between Ghana and China which was established four decades ago and which has been characterised in recent times by the visits of the vice president, Mr Jinn Jintao, in January 1999.He stated that the minister's visit is an illustration of the continued desire of both countries to strengthen their bonds of friendship.He expressed Ghana's appreciation for China's continued financial and technical assistance in the health, agriculture, education and, more recently, the construction sectors.The Afife Irrigation project, the National Theatre in Accra, construction of new housing units at police and military barracks and Dangbe East district hospital and vocational training school at Dansoman are all examples of Chinese projects from which Ghana has benefited.The deputy minister further expressed gratitude to the Chinese government on the cancellation of debts owed to China arising from loans given to Ghana from 1972 to 1998 and also the agreement in principle to provide financial support for the construction of 17.6 kilometre two-way lane and 40.5 kilometre dual carriage portions of the Accra-Kumasi road within three years.Explaining the NEPAD initiative to the vice Minister of Foreign Affairs, the minister said it is about Ghana's efforts to strengthen peace and security with good governance through NEPAD and efforts by the leaders of the sub-region to achieve a meaningful and sustainable development.He commended China for her contribution to Africa's development and hoped that the establishment of the Sino-Africa conference will offer more opportunities for Africa and China to continue to consult in the interest of concerted action aimed at addressing the wide range of issues of mutual concern and deepening the solidarity which is essential for addressing the common challenges presented by globalisation.The Chinese foreign minister on his part said Ghana is one of the sub-saharan countries to welcome China, with the leaders having a very profound relationship between them.He continued that despite the leadership changes, their relationship is still very cordial in the sense that their assistance to Ghana will not change because it is not directed to a particular government but to the people of Ghana.The foreign minister re-assured that the Chinese government is ready to work with the Kufuor administration since Ghana and China are all developing countries.He supported the NEPAD initiative and the preparedness of his government to join in its implementation. He hinted that a certain amount of money has been given to the Ghana government but the amount was however not known.by Linda AkrasiCopyright Ghanaian Chronicle. Distributed by All Africa GlobalMedia(AllAfrica.com)KEYWORD:          Ghana.Document afnws00020020620dy6k000xd
sector: Trade, Tourism, Banking and Financial Services

title: Ghanaian negotiations for customs service and an aluminum company
description: In 2004, Ghanaian Minister of Finance and Economic Planning, Yaw Osafo Maafo appealed to the Chinese government to provide The minister of finance and economic planning, Yaw Osafo Maafo, has appealed to the Chinese government to invest in the telecommunication and energy sectors. They should also help Ghana to set up a vehicle assembly plant.Mr Yaw Osafo Maafo made the appeal today when he signed an interest-free loan agreement of 3.75m dollars from the government of China to Ghana in Accra. The loan, which will be used for projects to be agreed upon by both governments, has a grace period of 10 years as well as the same repayment period. Mr Osafo Maafo said the government has created the necessary environment for investment in the country and therefore called on the Chinese government to help develop the railway system and road network.The finance minister hinted that negotiations are under way by government to revie the Volta Aluminium Company, and appealed to the Chinese government to assist. The finance minister further appealed to the Chinese government to provide the Customs, Excise and Preventive Service, CEPS, with a mobile scanner machine. This, he said, will enable CEPS to detect illegal goods and also enhance revenue generation.The leader of the Chinese delegation, Wei Jianguo, said China is ready to join the AGOA [African Growth and Opportunities Act] to process garments to other west African countries and to the US.Mr Wei, who is the Chinese deputy minister of commerce, said China is prepared to invest in agricultural produce especially palm oil and cocoa beans. He gave an assurance that China will support the government of Ghana in her efforts at poverty reduction and economic development.Source: Radio Ghana, Accra, in English 1300 gmt 10 Mar 04Document BBCAP00020040311e03b00001
sector_comment: Government Customs and domestic Aluminum Company

title: Not a project: Potential Fertilizer Investment
description: 'Text of report by Nigerian newspaper Daily Trust web site on 9 SeptemberThe Peoples Republic of China [PRC] which has expressed willingness to invest in the production of urea and fertiliser blending in Nigeria has been promised federal government assistance.Agriculture and Rural Development Minister Malam Adamu Bello said when an investment team from the PRC visited the ministry to explore investment opportunities in the Nigerian agricultural sector that the Nigerian market had the potential to take up to 5m t of fertiliser but gets only 0.5m t which he said was quite inadequate and has impacted negatively on crop production.He implored the Chinese team to visit areas in Nigeria where there are large deposits of urea and discuss with state governments who are always willing to engage in collaborative development of the natural resources in their states.Earlier, the leader of the Chinese investment team and Chairman CGC Oerseas, Mr Bian, had informed the minister of the team's interest in exploring investment opportunities in the Nigerian agricultural sector particularly in the area of fertiliser production.Also involved in the interactive session was the governor of Akwa Ibom State, Obong Victor Attah, who was on a working visit to the ministry and who invited the team to his state to inspect facilities available for fertiliser production.The state, he said, was already in partnership with Chinese companies in the areas of construction, oil exploration and power generation. '
donor_agency_count: CGC Overseas Construction Co., Ltd. (CGCOC), State-Owned Company
recipient_agencies: CGC Overseas Construction Co., Ltd. (CGCOC), State-Owned Company

title: $1 B Planned Investment : not a project
description: In 2003, China decided to invest over $1 billion in Nigeria.The status of the investment and associated projects are uncertain.

title: Not bilateral: Digital Equipment Donation
description: 'The executive secretary of ECOWAS [Economic Community of West African States], Dr Mohammed Ibn Chambas, has said that the pocket of conflicts in the subregion have slowed down integration programmes meant to raise the living standard of the community's citizens.Dr Chambas was speaking in Abuja when Chinese Ambassador Young Chu Wang presented some digital equipment to the ECOWAS secretariat in Abuja.He said additional officers have been recruited to man political affairs, defence, and security offices as part of efforts to ensure peace in West Africa.In his remarks, Mr Young Chu Wang, said the donation was a symbol of China's interest in the subregion.' 'The Chinese government has donated electronic equipment valued at 123,000 dollars (101,000 euros) to assist a 15-nation west African economic grouping in peacekeeping missions in the region.A statement by the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) said the items were presented to the organisation by Chinese Ambassador in Nigeria Wang Yang Oui in Abuja on Tuesday.It said the items included computers, fax machines, copiers, satellite phones and acccessories.The ambassador said the gesture was not only a demonstration of the fraternal relations between his country and ECOWAS, but also in appreciation of the contributions of the organisation's member states to the promotion of regional peace and security.'Without peace and security, development cannot take place and the year 2003 was full of challenges for ECOWAS, but through the collective efforts of the member-states, peace and stability has been restored to the region,' he said.ECOWAS executive secretary Mohammed Ibn Chambas thanked the Chinese government for the donation, adding that the items will facilitate work at the secretariat.'
sector_comment: Computers, Fax Machines, Copiers, Satellite phones, and accessories

title: loan to the state operator, Togo Telecom (Duplicate of 975)
description: 16 May 2009 04:52 AMBBC Monitoring Africa BBCAP English (c) 2009 The British Broadcasting Corporation. All Rights Reserved. No material may be reproduced except with the express permission of The British Broadcasting Corporation. Text of report by Togolese government website republicoftogo.com on 15 MayChina Exim Bank, specialized in funding projects in Africa and at the international level, on Friday 15 May granted a 15bn-CFA franc [approximately 31.7m dollars] loan to the state operator, Togo Telecom.The money will be used to develop the coverage of the 'Illico' telephone network. Using the RLL (Radio Local Loop), 'Illico' is proposing to customers a hybrid telephone which uses a fixed wireless terminal and mobile line at the same time at prices lower than those of GSM. Launched in Togo just over two years ago, this service has been very successful for subscribers because of the price and easy usage and an instant start-up in Togo. The telephone, when connected to a computer enables the subscriber to browse the internet and to retrieve his mails.The signing of this convention took place at the Office of the Minister of Economic Affairs and Finance, in the presence of the director-general of Togo Telecom, Sam Bikassam, the deputy governor of Exim Bank, Xhu Xinqiang, and the minister of economic affairs and finance, Adji Otheth Ayassor.Source: republicoftogo.com website, Lome, in French 15 May 09
donor_agency: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
recipient_agencies: Export-Import Bank of China, Government Agency
verified: Togo Telecom, State-Owned Company

title: Duty Free Privilege to Goods from Liberia
description: The Foreign Minister reiterated the Chinese earlier offer granting duty free privilege to goods from Liberia. He said the people of China would like to see a number of goods that are needed in China manufactured in Liberia and exported to that country on a duty free basis. Minister Nimely described this gesture as an opportunity and emphasized that, 'China is the only known world producer that has given such an offer to Liberia.' On the issue of Liberian Foreign Missions abroad, the Minister stated that conditions were 'ery bad' at these missions. He said many of these missions are in huge arrears while, staff have not been paid for months. Minister Nimely said he submitted a budget of US$18Million to Government to cover arrears of these missions and staff salaries. 'But to my surprise, only US$2Million of the amount has been approved', he said. The Foreign Minister said his ministry had contemplated on reducing the number of foreign missions for financial reasons. And by this, one embassy could represent Liberia's interest in a number of countries. 'But even by doing so, you still have to pay the arrears of the rest of the missions that would be closed and also meet the salary arrears of staff for which the US$18Million was needed', the Foreign Minister said．／／为了扩大从非洲国家的进口，促进中非双边贸易的进一步发展，中国自2005年1月1日起给予非洲最不发达国家部分输华商品免关税待遇。        对非洲最不发达国家部分商品进入中国市场给予免关税待遇，是中国作为发展中国家，根据目前自身经济能力，以积极的方式帮助非洲国家发展经济所做出的重要承诺。自2005年1月1日起，中国政府开始对2004年12月31日前已就免关税同中国政府办理有关换文的25个非洲最不发达国家部分输华商品实施免关税政策。　　这25个国家是：贝宁、布隆迪、佛得角、中非共和国、科摩罗、刚果民主共和国、吉布提、厄立特里亚、埃塞俄比亚、几内亚、几内亚比绍、莱索托、利比里亚、马达加斯加、马里、毛里塔尼亚、莫桑比克、尼日尔、卢旺达、塞拉利昂、苏丹、坦桑尼亚、多哥、乌干达、赞比亚。此次享受免税待遇的商品共计190个税目。
sector: Trade, Tourism, Banking and Financial Services

title: China Offers to help Finance the Rebuilding of Mt Coffee Hydro Plant
description: Foreign Minister Thomas Yaya Nimely has disclosed that the Chinese government has submitted a proposal to the National Transitional Government of Liberia to rehabilitate the Mount Coffee Hydro Plant situated in White Plains, outside Monrovia.Minister Nimely said in keeping with the Chinese government's proposal, it will pay 80% of the cost of the total rehabilitation of the hydro plant, while the balance 20%, will be paid by the Liberian government. The Foreign Minister made this disclosure at the Chinese Embassy in Congo Town, when he signed for and received a donation of Office Equipment valued at several thousands United States Dollars from the Government and People of China. Responding to journalists' questions as to whether the GOL would be vigilant and not play the usual see-saw game of shifting diplomatic ties between China and Taiwan, Minister Nimely said, despite many appeals by the government of Liberia to international partners to assist with the rehabilitation of the hydro. So far, he said, it is the Chinese government that has come up to assist the Liberian government with the project. Minister Nimely said it is now time for Liberians to focus their attention and look out for what he called 'crucial economic benefits' for their country rather than be looking for what he termed 'the political benefits' just for personal gains. He said Liberians should focus their attention on identifying the priorities of their country than what they can get for themselves, so other countries that would want to assist could do so. According to the Foreign Minister, Liberia has sufficient food and can feed itself, but noted that this is not the case because the nation has no farm-to-market roads to transport food items from one point to another. He then lauded the efforts of the Chinese government for its many assistance to Liberia, stressing that it is good for the nation to have friends who will bring in the technicians to assist with projects on the ground, as the Chinese are doing in other countries. He made specific reference to countries like Ghana, Ethiopia and Nigeria, where according to him, the Chinese have built bridges, railroads among others. During the occasion that was attended by Internal Affairs Minister Dan Morias among other government officials, the Chinese government donated typewriters, raincoats, ribbons and radio sets. The Chinese government also presented to Liberia, 50 units of typewriters, 250 rolls of ribbons, 8 units of radio sets and 300 units of raincoats. Out of the 50 units of typewriters presented to the country, three will be given to each of the 15 counties; 5 will go to the Ministry of Internal Affairs, while five of the 250 rolls of ribbons will be used for each of the type-writers. For the radios, 5 will go to each of the 15 counties as well the Ministry of Internal Affairs, while 20 pieces of the 300 raincoats will go to each of the fifteen counties. Speaking Wednesday when he presented the items, Chinese Ambassador to Liberia, Lin Songtian reiterated his earlier statement that his country would assist Liberia in its reconstruction efforts. Ambassador Songtian said, what Liberia needs is the capacity to build up, stressing that it is his hope that in the days to come, investors from his country would come to Liberia with the focus of assisting Liberians to assist themselves. For his part, Internal Affairs Minister Dan Morias assured the Chinese government and people that the items will be taken to the local government structure of these counties by helicopter. He said no local government structure can function in the absence of equipment and lauded the Chinese government for the gesture. ／／　2008年4月，中非发展基金总裁迟建新率团对利比里亚进行考察访问。访利期间，迟建新一行拜会了利副总统博阿凯，参加了利政府举办的利比里亚投资环境介绍会，先后考察了邦矿、咖啡山水电站和布坎南港口。中非发展基金拟支持中利联公司投资开发邦矿项目，同时也在探讨资助一些其他项目。
